data.question: What are the sources for purchasing the required chemicals for the synthesis of Zn(II) Schiff base complexes?
data.answer: Sigma Aldrich and Ranbaxy Fine Chemicals

data.question: What instrument was used to record the Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR) spectra at ambient temperature?
data.answer: AVANCE III 400 Ascend Bruker BioSpin machine

data.question: Which diffractometer was used for Single crystal X-ray structural studies of complex 1-4?
data.answer: CCD Agilent Technologies (Oxford Diffraction) SUPER NOVA diffractometer

data.question: What method was used to solve the structures during the X-ray crystallography of complexes 1-4?
What was the temperature at which the electrochemical experiments were performed?
What type of electrode assembly was used for the electrochemical experiments?
data.answer: A three-electrode assembly with working, reference (saturated calomel), and counter (platinum) electrode

data.question: What was the purpose of using FE-SEM and AFM in the study?
data.answer: To analyze the surface morphology of metal sample after immersion with and without inhibitor in 15% HCl

data.question: What strain was used for the antibacterial activity study?
What assay was performed to evaluate the antiproliferative activities of azido complexes 3 and 4?
What was the main conclusion regarding the corrosion preventing performances of the synthesized Zn(II) Schiff base complexes?
data.answer: The synthesized azido zinc complexes 3 and 4 showed considerable anti-corrosion property and also had potential antibacterial and antiproliferative activities
